intro: Gnaphalium niliacum, commonly known as the silver leaf weed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in dense, rounded inflorescences. Its leaves are covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Gnaphalium niliacum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows.
